techmeme.title: A profile of Rapidus, which is attempting to prove that bespoke chips can be efficiently and profitably produced in small quantities rather than large batches (Financial Times)
An artist shares his experience of turning to Replika's AI bot Lila for companionship, including giving Lila an AI friend by creating a digital copy of himself (Josh Dzieza/The Verge)
US hedge fund AQR's Cliff Asness, who is considered a quant legend, says AI has taken over parts of his job by being "annoyingly better" than him at some tasks (Justina Lee/Bloomberg)
Malwarebytes: 77% of ad accounts used for "malvertising" are used just once, and 90% of malicious ads in search results come from Pakistan and Vietnam (Lily Hay Newman/Wired)
Q&A with White House Office of Science and Technology Policy Director Arati Prabhakar on AI risks, the CHIPS Act, immigration for the STEM fields, and more (James O'Donnell/MIT Technology Review)
